sections.content: Within the wide world of business software, AI is the new king. Features that can utilize AI to help enhance or provide additional functionality to a team are now an important consideration when companies are looking for any new application for their business.

Within Zoho, Zia is the name of our AI platform that enables these types of functionality across our various apps. Within Desk, Zia currently enables various features, from sentiment analysis to gauge the tone of a customer's reply at a glance, to Reply Assistance where Zia will generate a reply suggestion based on the conversation of a ticket. Similar to automations, Zia gives tools to a team to help optimize how they engage with their customers through Desk.

items: Showcase and demonstrate the various features of Zia within Desk
Provide context to the use of some of these features, such as their uses within other modules

sections.content: Answer Bot uses AI to automatically respond to customer questions by searching your Knowledge Base and providing relevant article suggestions or direct answers.

items: Analyzes incoming customer questions
Searches Knowledge Base articles for relevant information
Provides article suggestions or generates answers based on KB content
Can respond automatically via email or through the Help Center
Learns from agent feedback to improve accuracy over time

sections.content: To maximize Answer Bot's effectiveness, structure your Knowledge Base articles properly:

items: **Clear Titles:** Use descriptive, question-based titles (e.g., "How do I reset my password?" instead of "Password Management")
**Structured Content:** Break content into clear sections with subheadings
**Direct Answers:** Put the most important information at the beginning
**Simple Language:** Avoid jargon and complex terminology
**Complete Information:** Ensure articles fully answer the question without requiring external links
**Regular Updates:** Keep articles current to maintain Answer Bot accuracy
**Tagging:** Use relevant tags to help Answer Bot categorize and find articles

sections.content: **Tip:** Articles formatted as FAQs with clear question-and-answer structure work particularly well with Answer Bot.

Answer Bot integrates seamlessly with ASAP (Zoho's self-service widget) to provide instant answers to customers before they even create a ticket. When customers type questions into ASAP, Answer Bot suggests relevant articles in real-time.
Zia can automatically predict and populate ticket fields based on the content of the ticket, saving agents time and improving data consistency.
Field Prediction requires training data to become accurate:

items: **Training Period:** Zia needs historical ticket data to learn patterns (typically 500+ tickets)
**Consistent Data:** The more consistently fields were filled in the past, the better predictions will be
**Predictable Fields:** Works best for fields like Category, Priority, Department, Product
**Agent Review:** Predictions should always be reviewed by agents before finalizing
**Continuous Learning:** Zia improves predictions as more tickets are processed

sections.content: **Important:** Field Prediction accuracy depends on the quality of your historical data. Inconsistent or incomplete past data will result in less accurate predictions.
Generative AI features in Desk help agents compose, improve, and summarize communications.
Zia can generate suggested replies based on the ticket conversation history:

items: Analyzes the full ticket conversation thread
Generates contextually appropriate response suggestions
Agents can edit suggestions before sending
Speeds up response times for common inquiries
Maintains professional tone and language

sections.content: Summarize long ticket conversations into concise overviews:

items: Condense lengthy email threads into key points
Help agents quickly understand ticket history
Can summarize entire conversation or specific portions
Useful for ticket handoffs between agents
Responses change based on what content is selected for summarization

sections.content: **Use Case:** When taking over a ticket with 15+ back-and-forth emails, use Reply Summary to quickly understand the issue, what's been tried, and what the customer needs.

items: **Tone Adjustment:** Make responses more friendly, formal, or empathetic
**Grammar Check:** Correct spelling and grammar errors
**Expand/Shorten:** Adjust response length as needed
**Translate:** Convert responses to different languages

sections.content: Zia analyzes the emotional tone of customer messages and assigns sentiment scores (Positive, Neutral, Negative).

items: Analyzes language, word choice, and context in customer messages
Assigns sentiment: Positive, Neutral, or Negative
Displays sentiment indicators on tickets
Tracks sentiment trends over time
Helps identify unhappy customers requiring immediate attention

sections.content: Sentiment can be used as a condition in workflow rules and other automations:

items: **Escalate Negative Sentiment:** Automatically escalate tickets with negative sentiment to supervisors
**Priority Adjustment:** Increase priority for tickets with very negative sentiment
**Supervisor Notifications:** Alert managers when multiple negative sentiment tickets are received
**Response Templates:** Use different response templates based on customer sentiment
**Follow-up Actions:** Schedule follow-up calls for negative sentiment tickets after resolution

sections.content: **Example Automation:** Create a workflow rule that triggers when sentiment is "Very Negative" to immediately assign the ticket to a senior agent and notify the support manager.
Zia Services provide the underlying AI engine and configuration options for all Zia features in Desk.
Understanding the difference between Zia and external AI services like ChatGPT:

items: **Zia:** Zoho's proprietary AI trained on your organization's data, integrated directly into Desk workflows
**ChatGPT Integration:** Can be configured to provide additional AI capabilities using OpenAI's models
**Data Privacy:** Zia keeps data within Zoho's ecosystem; external services may have different privacy policies
**Customization:** Zia learns from your specific Knowledge Base and ticket patterns
**Cost:** Zia is included with Desk plans; external AI may have additional API costs
Enable/disable specific Zia features
Set confidence thresholds for Answer Bot suggestions
Configure which departments or agents can use Zia features
Choose between Zia models and external AI services

sections.content: Zia uses advanced natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning models:

items: **Zia LLM (Large Language Model):** Zoho's proprietary language model for text generation and understanding
**Specialized Models:** Different models optimized for specific tasks (sentiment analysis, categorization, etc.)
**Continuous Training:** Models improve over time based on your organization's data
**Multi-language Support:** Trained on multiple languages for global support teams

sections.content: Zia Agents are AI-powered assistants that can handle end-to-end customer interactions autonomously.

items: Handle complete customer conversations without human intervention
Make decisions based on conversation context
Access Knowledge Base and other resources
Escalate to human agents when needed
Learn from interactions to improve performance

sections.content: **Future of Support:** Zia Agents represent the evolution toward fully autonomous support for routine inquiries, freeing human agents to focus on complex issues requiring empathy and creative problem-solving.
Zia LLM (Large Language Model) is Zoho's proprietary AI language model that powers generative features:

items: Powers Reply Assistance, Reply Summary, and content improvement features
Trained on business communication patterns
Designed specifically for customer support contexts
Privacy-focused - data stays within Zoho infrastructure
Continuously updated and improved

sections.content: Complete the following Zia exercises to experience AI features firsthand:

items: Create a test ticket in your Desk account

Simulate an email conversation with at least 5 back-and-forth messages: Customer describes a problem, Agent asks clarifying questions, Customer provides more details, Agent suggests a solution, Customer has follow-up questions
Add internal comments between some messages to simulate agent notes
Use Zia's **Reply Assistance** feature to generate a suggested response
Observe how Zia understands the conversation context
Edit the suggestion if needed and note what changes you made
Use **Reply Summary** on the entire conversation - note the key points Zia extracted
Select only the customer's messages and generate a summary - observe how it differs from the full conversation summary
Select only agent responses and generate a summary
Document how the summaries change based on what content is selected

sections.content: Activity 2: Answer Bot with Knowledge Base

items: Navigate to **Setup > Channels > Answer Bot**
Enable Answer Bot for your test department
Ensure your Knowledge Base has the articles you created in previous lessons (at least 3 articles)
Review your articles and optimize them using best practices: Add clear, question-based titles, Structure content with headers, Put key information at the beginning
Train Answer Bot on your Knowledge Base articles
Test Answer Bot by: Creating test tickets with questions your articles should answer, Checking if Answer Bot suggests the correct articles, Verifying the accuracy and relevance of suggestions
Note which types of questions Answer Bot handles well vs. poorly
Provide feedback to Answer Bot on correct/incorrect suggestions to help it learn

sections.content: **Step Beyond:** With your Answer Bot configured, explore the ASAP widget settings. See if you can figure out how to incorporate the Answer Bot within it so customers can get instant answers before submitting tickets.

items: Enable Sentiment Analysis in your Zia settings
Create test tickets with different emotional tones: One very positive/happy customer message, One neutral/informational message, One frustrated/angry customer message
Check if Zia correctly identifies the sentiment for each
Create a workflow rule that triggers on negative sentiment: Send notification to supervisor, Increase priority to High, Add tag "negative-sentiment"
Test the automation with a new negative sentiment ticket
